source: Integrated Maternal and Perinatal Care Guideline_23_10_2024_0
text:
hers. Intimate 
partner femicide (killing of a woman by her intimate partner) is the most extreme form of abuse. SA has the highest 
intimate femicide rate in the world. It is therefore very important to ask about abuse in the home. 
Possible health outcomes associated with IPV/DV 
• Pre-conception – 50% higher HIV incident infection, high- risk sexual behaviour, decreased contraception use,
higher unintended pregnancy
• Pregnancy – twice more likely to result in perinatal death, preterm labour,
